de.esoco.lib.xml

Class XmlUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.xml.XmlUtil

  • public class XmlUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides static helper functions for the handling of XML documents and files.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • addTagsAsProperties

        public static void addTagsAsProperties(org.w3c.dom.Node rNode,
                                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> rMap)
        Puts all child tag elements of a node as properties into a map. The property key will be the tag name and the value will be retrieved from the tag's child node of the type "text".
        Parameters:
        rNode - The node to get the properties from
        rMap - The map to place the properties in

      • evaluateXpathExpression

        public static java.lang.String evaluateXpathExpression(org.w3c.dom.Document rDocument,
                                                       java.lang.String sXpathExpression)
                                                throws javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException
        Evaluate an XPath expression in the specified context and return the result as a String.
        Parameters:
        rDocument - The source document
        sXpathExpression - The expression to evaluate
        Returns:
        The String that is the result of evaluating the expression and converting the result to a String.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException - If the expression can not be evaluated.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.String sXML,
                                      int nIndent,
                                      boolean bWithDeclaration)
        Formats an XML string into a readable format with one tag per line.
        Parameters:
        sXML - The XML input string
        nIndent - The indentation of each XML level
        bWithDeclaration - TRUE to include the XML declaration, FALSE to omit it
        Returns:
        The formatted XML string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the argument string cannot be formatted

      • getTagsAsProperties

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getTagsAsProperties(org.w3c.dom.Node rNode)
        Adds all child tag elements of a node as properties in a map. The property key will be the tag name and the value will be retrieved from the tag's child node of the type "text".
        Parameters:
        rNode - The node to get the properties from
        Returns:
        A new LinkedHashMap containing the node's tags as properties

      • getXmlAttributeValue

        public static java.lang.String getXmlAttributeValue(org.w3c.dom.Document rDocument,
                                                    java.lang.String sNodeTag,
                                                    java.lang.String sAttributeName,
                                                    java.lang.String sFormat)
        Returns the text content of a certain attribute of the first XML document node with a particular tag or NULL if either the node or the attribute doesn't exist. If the format string argument is not NULL it must contain a '%s' placeholder to insert the attribute value at.
        Parameters:
        rDocument - The XML document
        sNodeTag - The XML tag of the node to query
        sAttributeName - The name of the node attribute to query
        sFormat - An optional format string or NULL for none
        Returns:
        The text content of the XML node. An empty string if the node is empty.

      • getXmlNode

        public static org.w3c.dom.Node getXmlNode(org.w3c.dom.Document rDocument,
                                          java.lang.String sNodeTag)
        Returns the first XML document node with a certain tag or NULL if the node doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        rDocument - rDocument The XML document
        sNodeTag - The XML tag of the node to query
        Returns:
        The node or NULL for none

      • getXmlNodeContent

        public static java.lang.String getXmlNodeContent(org.w3c.dom.Document rDocument,
                                                 java.lang.String sNodeTag)
        Returns the text content of the first XML document node with a certain tag or NULL if the node doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        rDocument - The XML document
        sNodeTag - The XML tag of the node to query
        Returns:
        The node value or an empty string

      • getXmlNodeContent

        public static java.lang.String getXmlNodeContent(org.w3c.dom.Document rDocument,
                                                 java.lang.String sNodeTag,
                                                 java.lang.String sFormat)
        Returns the text content of the first XML document node with a certain tag or NULL if the node doesn't exist. If the format string argument is not NULL it must contain a '%s' placeholder to insert the node content at.
        Parameters:
        rDocument - The XML document
        sNodeTag - The XML tag of the node to query
        sFormat - An optional format string or NULL for none
        Returns:
        The node value or an empty string

      • getXmlNodes

        public static java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Node> getXmlNodes(org.w3c.dom.Document rDocument,
                                                           java.lang.String sNodeTag)
        Returns all XML document nodes with a certain tag.
        Parameters:
        rDocument - The XML document
        sNodeTag - The XML tag of the nodes to query
        Returns:
        The list of nodes (may be empty)

      • getXmlNodesContent

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getXmlNodesContent(org.w3c.dom.Document rDocument,
                                                                  java.lang.String sNodeTag)
        Returns the text contents of all XML document nodes with a certain tag.
        Parameters:
        rDocument - The XML document
        sNodeTag - The XML tag of the nodes to query
        Returns:
        A list containing the node values (may be empty)

      • nodeHierarchyToString

        public static java.lang.String nodeHierarchyToString(org.w3c.dom.Node rNode,
                                                     java.lang.String sIndent,
                                                     boolean bIncludeRoot)
        Converts an XML node and it's hierarchy of child nodes (if available) into a readable string representation.
        Parameters:
        rNode - The root XML node
        sIndent - A indentation prefix string or NULL for none
        bIncludeRoot - TRUE to include the root node in the result
        Returns:
        The string representation of the node hierarchy

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(org.w3c.dom.Node rNode)
        Returns a string representation of an XML node and it's hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        rNode - The node to convert into a string
        Returns:
        The string representation of the given node
